name: Lady Slipper Orchids
climate: Lady Slipper Orchids prefer temperate climates with moderate temperatures.
These orchids are native to forest floors and thrive in cool, shaded areas.
High humidity is essential for Lady Slipper Orchids to mimic natural habitat conditions.
Avoid extreme cold or hot climates, as they can damage the plant significantly.
sunlight: Lady Slipper Orchids require indirect sunlight to grow properly.
Too much direct sunlight can scorch their leaves and hinder growth.
They thrive in partial shade under the canopy of taller trees.
Bright, indirect light supports their flowering and overall health.
watering: Consistent moisture is key, but be careful not to overwater them.
Water them regularly to keep the soil moist, but well-drained.
Avoid letting the plant sit in water to prevent root rot issues.
During the growing season, they generally need more frequent watering.
soil: A well-draining potting medium that retains moisture is ideal.
Soil should ideally consist of a mix of fine bark, perlite, and peat moss.
Good aeration in the soil helps to maintain healthy root systems.

toxic: Lady Slipper Orchids are not known to be toxic to humans or pets.
extra_care_tip: Repot Lady Slipper Orchids every 2-3 years to refresh soil nutrients.
